intro: Tomoxis coarctata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tamarack, is a shrub native to North America. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptic to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, catkin-like flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds that are dispersed by wind. The species is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodlands and along streambanks.
